world_bible.title: The Drift
world_bible.logline: In a city that never sleeps, a masked underclass scavenges the wreckage of a civilization that forgot they existed.

setting.description: A dense, rain-slicked city of layered infrastructure — elevated walkways, flooded lower districts, flickering signage. The powerful live in the upper grid. Everything below belongs to the night. No names for neighborhoods; locals call the zones by what falls there: 'the glass level,' 'the rot,' 'the wire.'
setting.tone: Gritty optimism. The foragers aren't desperate — they're expert. The city is hostile but navigable. Survival is craft, not tragedy.
setting.visual_language: Masked faces, ringed eyes, hands always in motion. Boxy architectural forms. Pools of amber streetlight against deep blue shadow. Everything useful has been repurposed. Nothing is wasted.

characters.name: Cinder
characters.visual: Masked face with pale ringed markings around the eyes. Small, fast. Carries a worn satchel rebuilt from three different bags. Always has something in her hands.
characters.role: Lead forager. Knows every access point in the lower grid. Trades information as freely as salvage.

characters.name: Hollow
characters.visual: Tall, boxy silhouette. Thick-framed optical lenses that catch light wrong in the dark. Moves like someone used to being watched.
characters.role: Former grid administrator gone underground. Knows the infrastructure from the other side. Uncomfortable with how good he's gotten at surviving outside it.

characters.name: Silt
characters.visual: Amphibian cast to the face — wide-set eyes, damp skin that catches ambient light. Wears layered salvage clothing, always slightly wrong for the weather.
characters.role: Keeper of pre-collapse maps. Doesn't explain how he has them. Knows which lower tunnels flood and when.

characters.name: Zero
characters.visual: Stick-figure lean. Cigarette. Hoodie with the hood always up. Skate-worn shoes. Never seems to carry anything but always has what you need.
characters.role: Information broker. Doesn't forage — facilitates. Everybody knows Zero. Nobody knows where Zero sleeps.

factions.name: The Drift
factions.description: Loose collective of nocturnal foragers operating in the lower city. No hierarchy — reputation is currency. Entry is earned by surviving a solo night in the rot.
factions.visual: Masked faces, ringed eyes. Mix of salvage and purpose-built gear. No uniform except the mark — a double ring around one eye, burned or drawn.

factions.name: The Grid
factions.description: City administration and infrastructure managers. Control access to the upper levels and the power supply. Not villains — bureaucrats who stopped asking questions.
factions.visual: Boxy, formal. Thick optical lenses. Monochromatic color-coding by department. Always lit from above.

factions.name: The Deep
factions.description: Tunnel-dwellers who predate the current city by at least two infrastructure generations. Amphibian affinity — comfortable in flooded zones. Trade in water rights and passage.
factions.visual: Damp, layered salvage. Wide eyes. Move in single file through tight spaces. Never fully dry.

relationship_graph.relationship: de facto leader, refuses the title
emissary, operates above ground more than most
adjacent — not a member, not an outsider
uneasy alliance — water access for surface salvage

compliance_manifest.confidence_rationale: All four universes used carry primary CC0 evidence. racc00ns is highest confidence (self-declared, no flags). Nouns and CrypToadz carry medium trademark flags — visual primitives used throughout, brand names avoided as in-world proper nouns. mfers carries medium governance ambiguity (Sartoshi exit) and medium meme derivative flag. No flags are high or unresolved. Bulfinch's not used in this world — no jurisdiction flag applies. Commercial confidence computed as medium: CC0 confirmed across all sources, multiple medium flags present, no high or blocking flags.
open_questions: Nouns trademark: confirm visual primitive usage does not inadvertently recreate the Nouns brand identity closely enough to trigger confusion
CrypToadz/Pepe adjacency: Silt's amphibian visual should be reviewed against current meme landscape before any public image generation
